intro: Aeschynomene aspera var. oligarthra, commonly known as the hairy sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by elongated, spiral-shaped pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some areas. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
